Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: “We are grateful that the City of Oakland is holding Southwest accountable. We hope that Southwest policies and practices will finally change for good,”
Unnamed Group of People.Name of Source: Southwest employees (specifically, those represented by the Transport Workers Union of America Local 555)
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: represented by Eric Swygert, an elected ramp representative with the Transport Workers Union of America Local 555

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: According to the complaint, Southwest has been denying some of its workers in Oakland the right to use earned paid sick leave.
Document Sources.Source Justification: complaint filed in Alameda County Superior Court

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: In December 2020, the city and Southwest signed a settlement in which, among other things, the airline agreed to fully restore the sick leave hours it had canceled for certain workers between 2017 and 2020.
Document Sources.Source Justification: existing settlement agreement between the city and Southwest

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “The City of Oakland is committed to protecting workers by ensuring that all employers in Oakland are complying with laws that protect their rights,”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: authority on labor laws in Oakland

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “We are grateful that the City of Oakland is holding Southwest accountable. We hope that Southwest policies and practices will finally change for good,”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: elected ramp representative with the Transport Workers Union of America Local 555
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Southwest employee and representative of affected workers

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: A Southwest spokesperson told The Oaklandside that the assertion that any Oakland employee was forced to work while sick or take unpaid absences is unfounded.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: defending against allegations made by the City of Oakland

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: Last year, this relatively new department ordered a Radisson Hotel in East Oakland to pay $404,491 to workers who were allegedly underpaid for nearly a year.
Named Organization Sources.Name of Source: Oakland’s Department of Workforce Employment Standards
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: enforcer of wage and hour laws in the city
